GetObjectsResult.description: Server response for Active Directory objects inquiry API calls

url.description: Member Object Url as "https://graph.windows.net/0b1f9851-1bf0-433f-aec3-cb9272f093dc/directoryObjects/f260bbc4-c254-447b-94cf-293b5ec434dd", where "0b1f9851-1bf0-433f-aec3-cb9272f093dc" is the tenantId and "f260bbc4-c254-447b-94cf-293b5ec434dd" is the objectId of the member (user, application, servicePrincipal, group) to be added.

GroupAddMemberParameters.description: Request parameters for adding a member to a group

mailEnabled.description: Specifies whether the group is mail-enabled. Must be false. This is because only pure security groups can be created using the Graph API.

securityEnabled.description: Specifies whether the group is a security group. Must be true. This is because only pure security groups can be created using the Graph API.

odata.nextLink.description: the URL to get the next set of results.

securityEnabledOnly.description: If true only membership in security enabled groups should be checked. Otherwise membership in all groups should be checked

value.description: Group Ids of which the group is a member

groupId.description: The object ID of the group to check.

memberId.description: The object ID of the contact, group, user, or service principal to check for membership in the specified group.

value.description: true if the specified user, group, contact, or service principal has either direct or transitive membership in the specified group; otherwise, false.

accountEnabled.description: Enable the account. If it is enabled then true else false.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name (someuser@contoso.com). It must contain one of the verified domains for the tenant.

mailNickname.description: The mail alias for the user

immutableId.description: Needs to be specified if you are using a federated domain for the user's userPrincipalName (UPN) property while creating a new user account. It is used to associate an on-premises Active Directory user account to their Azure AD user object.
